Title: Market participants advise against a potential price cap on all EU gas imports
Description: It will be difficult and unadvisable to implement a price cap on Russian pipeline gas but also on all gases coming into the European Union, market participants told Kpler. They warned that price caps risk further reducing gas supplies to the bloc including global LNG which could find more attractive markets with higher prices
Author: DE

Title: Germany’s Deutsche ReGas started building the Lubmin FSRU
Description: Germany’s Deutsche ReGas started the construction of the 4.5 bn m3 Lubmin floating storage and regasification unit (FSRU) on Sep. 20. This is one of the five FSRUs under development in Germany. The country is trying to replace lost Russian pipeline volumes, which used to represent most of the German gas supply before the current energy crisis
Author: DE

Title: The UK lifted its moratorium on shale gas production in England
Description: On Sep. 22, the UK’s government lifted the moratorium on shale gas production in England to bolster the country’s energy security amid a severe energy crisis facing Europe. Over 100 new licenses for shale gas and oil exploration including for new blocs of the UK's continental shelf are expected to emerge as part of this effort
Author: DE
